# copypaste

<!-- badges: start -->
<!-- badges: end -->

The goal of copypaste is to accelate copyed data reading in R

## Installation

You can install the released version of copypaste from [CRAN](https://CRAN.R-project.org) with:

``` r
install.packages("copypaste")
# or
remotes::install_git("https://github.com/jcval94/copypaste.git")
```

## Example

This is a basic example which shows you how to solve a common problem:

First, it is necessary to copy a table using Ctrl + C directly from your browser, excel, google sheets, etc.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Standard_normal_table



```{r example}
library(copypaste)
## Not run
# copypaste()
```

Check your data with new_df
```{r datan,echo=FALSE}
new_df<-data.frame()
```

You can also change read.table parameters, e.g.

```{r pressure, echo = FALSE}
# copypaste(header = FALSE)
new_df
```
